lines.text: Why don't you get wise? This is a war. I'm hired to kill the enemy, and there ain't no book of rules about that. Every one I put away means one less to kill me. That's my job, and I'm doing it.
I'm a chauffeur for a graveyard, driving men to their deaths day after day.

[about Richards's death]
Somebody will get a nice, shiny medal for this.
Well you might be Fifi to the rest of the world, but you're nothing but Fanny to me.

[after Fifi corrects him on repeatedly calling her Fanny]
Well you might be Fifi to the rest of the world, but you're nothing but Fanny to me.
[He then gives her buttocks, fanny in N. America, a pat to much merriment]
